Latter Days is a very, VERY independent movie. And compared to many of today's more modern films, it's lacking on many parts. Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.

The story is told excellently through dialogue and action. The comedic timing of Elias Plymale is top notch

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.
